SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Configure Pagination Options for the Scaled Cart Page

Provide an efficient, intuitive experience for a buyer who browses a large number of cart items on the Scaled Cart page. Customize the Scaled Cart page's default pagination controls so that a buyer can effectively navigate all items in the cart.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13) only



USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To access CC Admin and change settings:	Access B2B Commerce for Visualforce Admin Settings permission set

You can configure the following pagination options on the Scaled Cart page:

Page Size
The number of cart items to show on the page at once. The Scaled Cart page shows a pagination legend (1)—such as Showing 1–5 of 22 Products—at the top and bottom of each page's results.
Page List Size
The number of direct links that are available at one time for navigating to other cart items. You can specify a maximum number of pagination links that can display at one time, regardless of how many pages of items there actually are. For example, maybe you want to make sure that at most four pagination links display, even if there are eight pages of items. The Scaled Cart page shows pagination controls (2) at the top and bottom of each page's results.
TIP To hide or otherwise modify the pagination legend and controls at the top or bottom of each page's results, override the appropriate CSS in your theme. For more information, see CSS Overrides for Cart Scale Components.

To configure the pagination options for the Scaled Cart page, update your storefront configuration settings.

On the CC Admin tab in your org, select your storefront (1).
In the Storefront Settings menu, select Configuration Settings (2).
From the Module picklist, select Paginator (3).
Specify the number of direct links that are available at one time for navigating to other cart items. Find the Page List Size configuration (4) where Page is all (5), and check its value (6).
TIP
The default value—3—specifies that at most three other pages of results are linked at any one time. This default value applies to all storefront pages where the Page List Size configuration is referenced, including the My Account page and Product List page version 1.0. To use this default value for the Scaled Part page, continue to the next step.
To specify a different value for the Scaled Cart page, click Override in the Action column. In the New Page Setting window, enter a different number for Value and enter Cart for Page, and click Create.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Paginator
Configuration	Page List Size
Page	Cart
Value	An integer, such as 2 or 6.
To specify the number of cart items to show per page, find the Page Size configuration (7) where Page is Cart (8), and find its value (9).
TIP
The default value—25—specifies that at most 25 major cart items display per paginated Scaled Cart page. To use this default value for the Scaled Part page, continue to the next step.
To specify a different value for the Scaled Cart page, click Override in the Action column. In the New Page Setting window, enter a different number for Value and enter Cart for Page, and click Create.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Paginator
Configuration	Page Size
Page	Cart
Value	An integer, such as 10 or 20.
Build and activate a new configuration cache.

title: Configuring Pagination Options for the Scaled Cart Page
keywords: Page Size and List Size configuration
